body_html: I also notice that boosted_trees is using what I think is a deprecated version of the Estimator class. I discovered this when <instance of GBTClassifier>.train(input_fn=my_input_fun) throw an error. Seems like .fit accomplishes the same goal but this created some uncertainty about how compatible the boosted_trees estimators were with other tf features (like SavedModel).
body_text: I also notice that boosted_trees is using what I think is a deprecated version of the Estimator class. I discovered this when <instance of GBTClassifier>.train(input_fn=my_input_fun) throw an error. Seems like .fit accomplishes the same goal but this created some uncertainty about how compatible the boosted_trees estimators were with other tf features (like SavedModel).
body: I also notice that `boosted_trees` is using what I think is a deprecated version of the `Estimator` class. I discovered this when `<instance of GBTClassifier>.train(input_fn=my_input_fun)` throw an error. Seems like `.fit` accomplishes the same goal but this created some uncertainty about how compatible the `boosted_trees` estimators were with other `tf` features (like SavedModel).
